This removes a bit of code duplication.

Suggested change
if (channelConfig == null
|| channelConfig.getChannelTypeDescription().getGetAction().getPostProcessor() == null) {
return state;
}
String postProcessor = channelConfig.getChannelTypeDescription().getGetAction().getPostProcessor();
String postProcessor = channelConfig != null ? channelConfig.getChannelTypeDescription().getGetAction().getPostProcessor() : null;
if(postProcessor == null){
return state;
}

timeline.bodyHTML:
Minor adjustment to refactor the callback.sendUpdate.

Suggested change
match.ifPresentOrElse(name -> callback.sendUpdate(new StringType(name)), () -> {
logger.debug("Number '{}' not found in phonebook '{}' from provider '{}'", state, phonebookName,
thingUID);
callback.sendUpdate(state);
});
State newState = match.map(name -> (State) new StringType(name)).orElse(state);
if(newState == state) {
logger.debug("Number '{}' not found in phonebook '{}' from provider '{}'", state, phonebookName,
thingUID);
}
callback.sendUpdate(newState);
timeline.author: cpmeister

replies.bodyText: This can only happen if the user decides to use textual configuration. So he/she'll probably be an advanced user and be able to figure it out. The UI doesn't allow to save an invalid config.  It would require removing the valid-check in the configuration classes and IMO the code is much clearer this way.

replies.author: J-N-K

timeline.bodyHTML:
The previous logic really irked me because field assignment was getting performed inside of the streaming lambdas which I'd prefer to occur outside of your lambda logic. I went ahead and rearranged the logic but even now I'm not sure that it looks all that great. This logic should probably be refactored into several different methods.

Oh, I also noticed that you were not checking for null values in your final phonebook list so I fixed that.

Suggested change
scpdUtil.getDevice("").ifPresent(deviceType -> deviceType.getServiceList().stream()
.filter(service -> service.getServiceId().equals(serviceId)).findFirst().ifPresent(scpdService -> {
try {
SOAPMessage soapMessagePhonebookList = soapConnector.doSOAPRequest(scpdService,
"GetPhonebookList", Collections.emptyMap());
SOAPValueConverter soapValueConverter = new SOAPValueConverter(httpClient);
phonebooks = soapValueConverter
.getStateFromSOAPValue(soapMessagePhonebookList, "NewPhonebookList", null)
.map(phonebookList -> Arrays.stream(phonebookList.toString().split(",")).map(index -> {
try {
SOAPMessage soapMessageURL = soapConnector.doSOAPRequest(scpdService,
"GetPhonebook", Map.of("NewPhonebookID", index));
return soapValueConverter
.getStateFromSOAPValue(soapMessageURL, "NewPhonebookURL", null)
.map(url -> (Phonebook) new Tr064PhonebookImpl(httpClient,
url.toString()))
.orElse(null);
} catch (Tr064CommunicationException e) {
logger.warn("Failed to get phonebook with index {}:", index, e);
}
return null;
}).collect(Collectors.toList())).orElse(Collections.emptyList());
} catch (Tr064CommunicationException e) {
phonebooks = Collections.emptyList();
}
}));
phonebooks = scpdUtil.getDevice("")
.flatMap(deviceType -> deviceType.getServiceList().stream()
.filter(service -> service.getServiceId().equals(serviceId))
.findFirst())
.map(scpdService -> {
try {
return soapConnector.doSOAPRequest(scpdService,
"GetPhonebookList", Collections.emptyMap());
} catch (Tr064CommunicationException e) {
return null;
}
}).map(soapMessagePhonebookList -> {
SOAPValueConverter soapValueConverter = new SOAPValueConverter(httpClient);
return soapValueConverter
.getStateFromSOAPValue(soapMessagePhonebookList, "NewPhonebookList", null)
.map(phonebookList -> Arrays.stream(phonebookList.toString().split(",")))
.orElse(Streams.empty())
.map(index -> {
try {
SOAPMessage soapMessageURL = soapConnector.doSOAPRequest(scpdService,
"GetPhonebook", Map.of("NewPhonebookID", index));
return soapValueConverter
.getStateFromSOAPValue(soapMessageURL, "NewPhonebookURL", null)
.map(url -> (Phonebook) new Tr064PhonebookImpl(httpClient,
url.toString()))
.orElse(null);
} catch (Tr064CommunicationException e) {
logger.warn("Failed to get phonebook with index {}:", index, e);
}
return null;
})
.filter(Objects:nonNull)
.collect(Collectors.toList());
}).orElse(Collections.emptyList());
timeline.author: cpmeister

timeline.bodyHTML:
I wonder if it is worth it to make utility methods for these frequently used name lookups...

private Function<SCPDActionType, Optional<SCPDArgumentType> getArgument(String argumentName, String direction){
    return (action) -> action.getArgumentList().stream()
                                        .filter(argument -> argument.getName().equals(argumentName)
                                                && argument.getDirection().equals(direction))
                                        .findFirst();
}

private Function<SCPDServiceType,  Optional<SCPDActionType>> getAction(String actionName){
    return (service) -> service.getActionList().stream().filter(action -> action.getName().equals(actionName)).findFirst();
}
Suggested change
SCPDActionType getInfoAction = scpdUtil.getService(deviceService.getServiceId())
.orElseThrow(() -> new SCPDException(
"Could not get service definition for 'urn:DeviceInfo-com:serviceId:DeviceInfo1'"))
.getActionList().stream().filter(action -> action.getName().equals("GetInfo")).findFirst()
.orElseThrow(() -> new SCPDException("Action 'GetInfo' not found"));
SCPDActionType getInfoAction = scpdUtil.getService(deviceService.getServiceId())
.orElseThrow(() -> new SCPDException(
"Could not get service definition for 'urn:DeviceInfo-com:serviceId:DeviceInfo1'"))
.flatMap(getAction("GetInfo"))
.orElseThrow(() -> new SCPDException("Action 'GetInfo' not found"));
timeline.author: cpmeister
